Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. The loop should consist of 1 circle (circle\\_1). The circle is defined as follows: * Center: (0.05, 0.05) * Radius: 0.05 Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.1 using the sketch\\_scale parameter. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch opposite the normal direction by a depth of 0.0542 to create the 3D model. Perform a cut operation using the second part and the first part. The resulting CAD model will be a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved top. The height, width, and length of each part, as well as the final shape, are as follows: * Part 1: height = 0.75, width = 0.0833, length = 0.75 * Part 2: height = 0.1, width = 0.0542, length = 0.1 * Final shape: height = 0.1, width = 0.0833, length = 0.75.</description>
